GS Caltex is a South Korean oil refiner. The company changed its name from LG-Caltex Oil Corporation to GS Caltex Corporation on January 27, 2006. It is jointly owned by Chevron and GS Group. GS Caltex was founded in May 1967 as the first private oil company in Korea.

Kixx automotive lubricants are formulated with Triple Double Technology, an exclusive and unique technology developed through extensive research and testing at GS Caltex. Consisting of Triple Anti Technology and Double Boosting Technology, our Triple Double Technology delivers optimized performance anytime, anywhere.

Kixx CVTF is Fully Synthetic premium quality transmission fluid designed to meet the service fill use in a broad range of Continuously Variable Transmissions(CVT).

This CVTF is a specially formulated to provide excellent driving comfort, longer life of transmission, extended service interval, excellent wear control and durability between belt and pully. It is recommended for use in all of the push belt type CVT. And it is recommended to be used in chain type CVTs.

Kixx ATF DX-III Fully Synthetic is superior to any other past or currently ATF for uses in passenger car with automatic transmission. And It can be recommended for Automatic transmission with lock-up clutch.

Kixx ATF DX-III Fully Synthetic is superior to any other past or currently ATF for uses in passenger car with automatic transmission. And It can be recommended for Automatic transmission with lock-up clutch. It provides a higher quality performance due in part by its oxidation resistance, low temperature fluidity, appropriate friction performance, high shear stability, and near sludge free operation.

Kixx ATF DX-VI is a premium performance, low viscosity multi-vehicle fluid for modern automatic transmissions, which is blended with synthetic base stocks and advanced high performance additives. It is specially designed to provide improved fuel efficiency and excellent shudder control performance.

Kixx ATF DX-VI is officially approved for use by GM and meets or exceeds the requirements of latest OEM specifications such as Ford MERCON LV, Toyota WS, Nissan Matic S, Hyundai SP-IV/SP-IV-RR. It is also suitable for most modern 6+ speed automatic transmissions.

Kixx Geartec GL-5 80W-90 is High performance, multipurpose, thermally stable, EP automotive gear lubricant.

"• KIXX Geartec GL-5 API GL-5. MIL-L-2105D High performance, multipurpose, thermally stable, EP automotive gear lubricant. • Recommended for automotive hypoid gear applications requiring lubricants meeting MIL-PRF-2105E, MIL-L-2105D, MILL-2105C, MIL-L-2105B, API Service GL-5 or where EP, multi-purpose or hypoid type gear oils are specified. • Recommended where loading is severe and maximum gear protection is required. “Clean gear” technology makes it particularly suitable where gear oil temperatures are high."

How to choose best oil for my car?

Selecting the right engine oil can be challenging for most of us. Multiple types, different numbers, letters, variant grades, and viscosity are available in the market. So, how to select the right one? Will it be ideal for the current weather conditions? How long will it last before a change is recommended? Is it ok to mix them up?
Seems like quite a challenging decision to make! That’s why we usually leave it to the mechanic to recommend one for us.
But not to worry, in this article, we will guide you to pick the right oil for your car.
What kind of oil you need depends on the engine. All new cars will come with a recommended grade listed in the car manual. The grade will be shown in numbers, separated by the letter ‘w’ – for example, 5w40. “The ‘w’ rating, preceded by a number, gives you an indication of how the oil flows (Viscosoty) at winter temperatures and the last number indicates flow (Viscosity) in summer temperatures.”
Not all engine oils are the same. It is important to choose an oil that is suited to your car and local climate conditions to enjoy all its benefits. Following are the main types of oil: \n\n "Mineral Oil:
Mineral oil, also known as “conventional oil”, is the most basic & affordable type of engine oils, obtained from refined petroleum crude oil.
Mineral oil is thicker than other oil types which causes a slower flow rate that results in increased fuel consumption.
Mineral engine oils are less resistant to high temperatures and oxidation compared to synthetic engine oils, and have higher liquid points, which makes them favorable for winter conditions and extremely low temperatures.
And because of that, mineral oils require frequent oil changes, after every 5,000 kilometers or every four months. \n\n" "Synthetic Oil: \n
Synthetic oil is a product of complex chemical transformations that are performed either directly on drilled crude petroleum or using preselected molecules. It undergoes more sophisticated modification.They hold many advantages: - Synthetics dont break down or sludge up as fast as ordinary mineral-based oils do. In other words, it has less deposit formation which leads to cleaner engines. - Better engine protection that increases its health & life span - Stable flow performance & viscosity during extreme temperatures - Fuel consumption optimization And not to forget, one of its main perks is that it requires less frequent oil changes. Synthetic oil can last between 8,000 to 15,000 kilometers or every six months before its next change.
However, the main disadvantage of synthetic oils that makes the least favorite to people is that they are slightly more expensive. \n\n" "Semi-Synthetic Oil:
\n Semi-Synthetic oil is also known as synthetic blends & as hybrid lubricants; is a mixture of mineral and synthetic oils that reserves the best features of both oils.
Semi-synthetic oils can be the best choice for engines that encounter heavy loads caused by intensive usage.
Semi-synthetic oil is more of a wallet-friendly than fully synthetic oil as they are of a lower cost. While getting some benefits of the fully-synthetic oil, it can be your next best choice." \n\n "Did You Ever Wondered?? Have you ever looked at the engine oil bottle and wondered what all these numbers and letters stand for? There are many different ways in describing motor oils, each refers to a certain standard of classification. ​​​​​Here are the three standards used for describing the oils: - The API standard - The SAE standard - The ACEA standard You can get more detailed information of all these standards and lubricants info on below link of our website"

KIXX is Korea’s leading lubricant and Global Brand under the umbrella of GS (founded jointly by Korean group and American Caltex), sold in more than 63 countries worldwide including Saudi Arabia. KIXX lubricants are recognized for their superior quality and technology.We have all kind of Automitive Engine Oils for all types of vehicles including - Petrol Cars / Passanger cars Premium Engine Oil - Diesel Vehicles Engine Oil
What kind of services does Kixx provide?

We are keen to provide our customers with the best care for their car by providing them with
1. No. 1 Engine oil to keep the engine safe from wear and enhance fuel economy
2. We guide you to the nearest oil change shops through our KIXX APP to make sure that our services are available near to you and accessible easily all the time no matter where you are.
3. We provide all our users to keep log of oil change maintenance for all your cars seperately, no matter what the numbers are; individuals and corporate, so that you always know what your car needs
4. We also aim to provide you with a good technical knowledge of what engine oils really do and why you need the best quality oil.
What types of oils does Kixx provide?

you name it and we have it!
We have full range of engine oils needed for your cars
1. Gasoline Engine Oils: 0W20, 0W40, 5W20, 5W30, 5W40, 10W30, 10W40, 20W50
2. Diesel Engine Oils: 15W40 CI4
3. Automatic Transmission Fluids: ATF III, ATF VI, CVTF
4. Gear Oils: n80W90 (GL5), 85W140 (GL5l

Yes! We are already present on most of oil change shops in Riyadh and Dammam Regions. In case you need any assistance for your nearby shop. Please advise your area and we can share with you the nearest locations. Or you can also get us online through our mobile APP."
When do I have to change the car oil?

Depending on vehicle age, type of oil and driving conditions, oil change intervals will vary. It used to be normal to change the oil every 3,000 miles, but with modern lubricants most engines today have recommended oil change intervals of 5,000 to 7,500 miles. Moreover, if your car engine requires full-synthetic motor oil, it might go as far as 10,000 miles between services! You cannot judge engine oil condition by color, so follow the factory maintenance schedule for oil changes. Tip: early oil change enhances the life of your engine and saves cost on a longer run.
What are the advantages of Kixx oil?

Kixx automotive lubricants are formulated with Triple Double Technology, an exclusive and unique technology developed through extensive research and testing at GS Caltex. Consisting of Triple Anti Technology and Double Boosting Technology, our Triple Double Technology delivers optimized performance anytime, anywhere.
1. Triple Anti Technology significantly reduces friction within the engine through friction modifiers, ultimately improving fuel economy.
2. Triple Anti Technology prevents and eliminates formation of varnish and sludge that are caused by thermal oxidation of lubricants in high temperatures.
3. Triple Anti Technology protects and prolongs engine life through anti-wear additives that forms lubricating film between moving parts.
4. Double Boosting Technology allows temperature stability to be maintained in a wide spectrum of temperatures
5. Double Boosting Technology boosts shear stability and enhanced shear stability of Kixx products allows the required properties and viscosity to be maintained consistently throughout usage.
